Interface netscape.application.DragDestination

public interface DragDestination
Interface for objects interested in receiving dragged objects. A DragSession, an object representing the object currently being dragged and managing the modal drag session itself, calls these methods at various times during a drag session. The current DragDestination is the object returned by the acceptsDrag() method of the View currently under the mouse.

See Also:
acceptsDrag, DragSession

dragDropped(DragSession)
Called when the user drops an object on a View.
dragEntered(DragSession)
Called when the user drags an object into a View.
dragExited(DragSession)
Called when the user drags an object out of a View.
dragMoved(DragSession)
Called when the user drags an object within a View.

dragEntered 
 public abstract boolean dragEntered(DragSession session)
Called when the user drags an object into a View. The receiver should return true if it would accept the object if the user released it at its current location.

dragMoved 
 public abstract boolean dragMoved(DragSession session)
Called when the user drags an object within a View. The receiver should return true if it would accept the object if the user released it at its current location.

dragExited 
 public abstract void dragExited(DragSession session)
Called when the user drags an object out of a View.

dragDropped 
 public abstract boolean dragDropped(DragSession session)
Called when the user drops an object on a View.
